member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.AmazonPricingDefaultConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration for accessing Amazon Pricing service

member.name: M:Amazon.Pricing.AmazonPricingDefaultConfiguration.GetAllConfigurations
member.summary: Collection of all s supported by Pricing

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Internal.AmazonPricingEndpointProvider
member.summary: Amazon Pricing endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of PricingEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Amazon.Pricing.Internal.AmazonPricingEndpointProvider.ResolveEndpoint(Amazon.Runtime.Endpoints.EndpointParameters)
member.summary: Resolve endpoint for PricingEndpointParameters

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Internal.AmazonPricingEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon Pricing endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for Pricing service requests. Collects values for PricingEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses PricingEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.summary: The values of a given attribute, such as Throughput Optimized HDD or Provisioned IOPS for the Amazon EC2 volumeType attribute.

Gets and sets the property Value.
The specific value of an attributeName.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeServices operation. Returns the metadata for one service or a list of the metadata for all services. Use this without a service code to get the service codes for all services. Use it with a service code, such as AmazonEC2, to get information specific to that service, such as the attribute names available for that service. For example, some of the attribute names available for EC2 are volumeType, maxIopsVolume, operation, locationType, and instanceCapacity10xlarge.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesRequest.FormatVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FormatVersion.
The format version that you want the response to be in.
Valid values are: aws_v1

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results that you want returned in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you want to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesRequest.ServiceCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceCode.
The code for the service whose information you want to retrieve, such as AmazonEC2. You can use the ServiceCode to filter the results in a GetProducts call. To retrieve a list of all services, leave this blank.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeServices operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesResponse.FormatVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FormatVersion.
The format version of the response. For example, aws_v1.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token for the next set of retrievable results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesResponse.Services
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Services.
The service metadata for the service or services in the response.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.Filter
member.summary: The constraints that you want all returned products to match.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.Filter.Field
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Field.
The product metadata field that you want to filter on. You can filter by just the service code to see all products for a specific service, filter by just the attribute name to see a specific attribute for multiple services, or use both a service code and an attribute name to retrieve only products that match both fields.
Valid values include: ServiceCode, and all attribute names
For example, you can filter by the AmazonEC2 service code and the volumeType attribute name to get the prices for only Amazon EC2 volumes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.Filter.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of filter that you want to use.
Valid values are: TERM_MATCH. TERM_MATCH returns only products that match both the given filter field and the given value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.Filter.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The service code or attribute value that you want to filter by. If you're filtering by service code this is the actual service code, such as AmazonEC2. If you're filtering by attribute name, this is the attribute value that you want the returned products to match, such as a Provisioned IOPS volume.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetAttributeValues operation. Returns a list of attribute values. Attributes are similar to the details in a Price List API offer file. For a list of available attributes, see Offer File Definitions in the Billing and Cost Management User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesRequest.AttributeName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeName.
The name of the attribute that you want to retrieve the values for, such as volumeType.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return in response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you want to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesRequest.ServiceCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceCode.
The service code for the service whose attributes you want to retrieve. For example, if you want the retrieve an EC2 attribute, use AmazonEC2.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetAttributeValues operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesResponse.AttributeValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeValues.
The list of values for an attribute. For example, Throughput Optimized HDD and Provisioned IOPS are two available values for the AmazonEC2 volumeType.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetAttributeValuesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetPriceListFileUrlRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetPriceListFileUrl operation. This feature is in preview release and is subject to change. Your use of Amazon Web Services Price List API is subject to the Beta Service Participation terms of the Amazon Web Services Service Terms (Section 1.10).
This returns the URL that you can retrieve your Price List file from. This URL is based on the PriceListArn and FileFormat that you retrieve from the ListPriceLists response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetPriceListFileUrlRequest.FileFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileFormat.
The format that you want to retrieve your Price List files in. The FileFormat can be obtained from the ListPriceLists response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetPriceListFileUrlRequest.PriceListArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PriceListArn.
The unique identifier that maps to where your Price List files are located. PriceListArn can be obtained from the ListPriceLists response.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetPriceListFileUrlResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetPriceListFileUrl operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetPriceListFileUrlResponse.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The URL to download your Price List file from.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetProducts operation. Returns a list of all products that match the filter criteria.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsRequest.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
The list of filters that limit the returned products. only products that match all filters are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsRequest.FormatVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FormatVersion.
The format version that you want the response to be in.
Valid values are: aws_v1

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you want to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsRequest.ServiceCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceCode.
The code for the service whose products you want to retrieve.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetProducts operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsResponse.FormatVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FormatVersion.
The format version of the response. For example, aws_v1.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.GetProductsResponse.PriceList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PriceList.
The list of products that match your filters. The list contains both the product metadata and the price information.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListPriceLists operation. This feature is in preview release and is subject to change. Your use of Amazon Web Services Price List API is subject to the Beta Service Participation terms of the Amazon Web Services Service Terms (Section 1.10).
This returns a list of Price List references that the requester if authorized to view, given a ServiceCode, CurrencyCode, and an EffectiveDate. Use without a RegionCode filter to list Price List references from all available Amazon Web Services Regions. Use with a RegionCode filter to get the Price List reference that's specific to a specific Amazon Web Services Region. You can use the PriceListArn from the response to get your preferred Price List files through the GetPriceListFileUrl API.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsRequest.CurrencyCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrencyCode.
The three alphabetical character ISO-4217 currency code that the Price List files are denominated in.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsRequest.EffectiveDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EffectiveDate.
The date that the Price List file prices are effective from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you want to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsRequest.RegionCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegionCode.
This is used to filter the Price List by Amazon Web Services Region. For example, to get the price list only for the US East (N. Virginia) Region, use us-east-1. If nothing is specified, you retrieve price lists for all applicable Regions. The available RegionCode list can be retrieved from GetAttributeValues API.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsRequest.ServiceCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceCode.
The service code or the Savings Plan service code for the attributes that you want to retrieve. For example, to get the list of applicable Amazon EC2 price lists, use AmazonEC2. For a full list of service codes containing On-Demand and Reserved Instance (RI) pricing, use the DescribeServices API.
To retrieve the Reserved Instance and Compute Savings Plan price lists, use ComputeSavingsPlans.
To retrieve Machine Learning Savings Plans price lists, use MachineLearningSavingsPlans.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListPriceLists operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsResponse.PriceLists
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PriceLists.
The type of price list references that match your request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.PriceList.FileFormats

Gets and sets the property FileFormats.
The format you want to retrieve your Price List files. The FileFormat can be obtained from the ListPriceList response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.PriceList.PriceListArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PriceListArn.
The unique identifier that maps to where your Price List files are located. PriceListArn can be obtained from the ListPriceList response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.Model.PriceList.RegionCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegionCode.
This is used to filter the Price List by Amazon Web Services Region. For example, to get the price list only for the US East (N. Virginia) Region, use us-east-1. If nothing is specified, you retrieve price lists for all applicable Regions. The available RegionCode list can be retrieved from
GetAttributeValues API.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.AmazonPricingClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Pricing
The Amazon Web Services Price List API is a centralized and convenient way to programmatically query Amazon Web Services for services, products, and pricing information. The Amazon Web Services Price List uses standardized product attributes such as Location, Storage Class, and Operating System, and provides prices at the SKU level. You can use the Amazon Web Services Price List to do the following:
Build cost control and scenario planning tools
Reconcile billing data
Forecast future spend for budgeting purposes
Provide cost benefit analysis that compare your internal workloads with Amazon Web Services
Use GetServices without a service code to retrieve the service codes for all Amazon Web Services, then GetServices with a service code to retrieve the attribute names for that service. After you have the service code and attribute names, you can use GetAttributeValues to see what values are available for an attribute. With the service code and an attribute name and value, you can use GetProducts to find specific products that you're interested in, such as an AmazonEC2 instance, with a Provisioned IOPS volumeType.
For more information, see Using the Amazon Web Services Price List API in the Billing User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.Pricing.AmazonPricingClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPricingClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Pricing.AmazonPricingClient.DescribeServicesAsync(Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns the metadata for one service or a list of the metadata for all services. Use this without a service code to get the service codes for all services. Use it with a service code, such as AmazonEC2, to get information specific to that service, such as the attribute names available for that service. For example, some of the attribute names available for EC2 are volumeType, maxIopsVolume, operation, locationType, and instanceCapacity10xlarge.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeServices service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeServices service method, as returned by Pricing.
member.exception: The pagination token expired. Try again without a pagination token.
An error on the server occurred during the processing of your request. Try again later.
The pagination token is invalid. Try again without a pagination token.
One or more parameters had an invalid value.
The requested resource can't be found.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeServices Operation

summary.para: This returns a list of Price List references that the requester if authorized to view, given a ServiceCode, CurrencyCode, and an EffectiveDate. Use without a RegionCode filter to list Price List references from all available Amazon Web Services Regions. Use with a RegionCode filter to get the Price List reference that's specific to a specific Amazon Web Services Region. You can use the PriceListArn from the response to get your preferred Price List files through the GetPriceListFileUrl API.

member.name: T:Amazon.Pricing.IAmazonPricing
member.summary:
Interface for accessing Pricing
The Amazon Web Services Price List API is a centralized and convenient way to programmatically query Amazon Web Services for services, products, and pricing information. The Amazon Web Services Price List uses standardized product attributes such as Location, Storage Class, and Operating System, and provides prices at the SKU level. You can use the Amazon Web Services Price List to do the following:
Build cost control and scenario planning tools
Reconcile billing data
Forecast future spend for budgeting purposes
Provide cost benefit analysis that compare your internal workloads with Amazon Web Services
Use GetServices without a service code to retrieve the service codes for all Amazon Web Services, then GetServices with a service code to retrieve the attribute names for that service. After you have the service code and attribute names, you can use GetAttributeValues to see what values are available for an attribute. With the service code and an attribute name and value, you can use GetProducts to find specific products that you're interested in, such as an AmazonEC2 instance, with a Provisioned IOPS volumeType.
For more information, see Using the Amazon Web Services Price List API in the Billing User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Pricing.IAmazonPricing.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.Pricing.IAmazonPricing.DescribeServicesAsync(Amazon.Pricing.Model.DescribeServicesRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns the metadata for one service or a list of the metadata for all services. Use this without a service code to get the service codes for all services. Use it with a service code, such as AmazonEC2, to get information specific to that service, such as the attribute names available for that service. For example, some of the attribute names available for EC2 are volumeType, maxIopsVolume, operation, locationType, and instanceCapacity10xlarge.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeServices service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeServices service method, as returned by Pricing.

member.name: M:Amazon.Pricing.IAmazonPricing.ListPriceListsAsync(Amazon.Pricing.Model.ListPriceListsRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

i.b: This feature is in preview release and is subject to change. Your use of Amazon Web Services Price List API is subject to the Beta Service Participation terms of the Amazon Web Services Service Terms (Section 1.10).

summary.para: This returns a list of Price List references that the requester if authorized to view, given a ServiceCode, CurrencyCode, and an EffectiveDate. Use without a RegionCode filter to list Price List references from all available Amazon Web Services Regions. Use with a RegionCode filter to get the Price List reference that's specific to a specific Amazon Web Services Region. You can use the PriceListArn from the response to get your preferred Price List files through the GetPriceListFileUrl API.

member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListPriceLists service method.
